info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:03AM EDT until April 7 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers...
Great Miami River at Franklin.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Great Miami River at Franklin.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, In addition to flooding onto low areas of Oxford Road near the railway bridge, water floods basements of riverside apartments along Dayton-Oxford Road. Water extends nearly to Dayton-Oxford Road itself in Chautauqua in Warren County on the west bank and onto North Dixie Highway on the east bank. Areas of Franklin protected by Miami Conservancy District Levees do not flood until stages at and above 22 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 16.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/iln.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY EVENING
